author: Travis
title: "ADA" Visual Scripting VSCode Ext.
description: The complexity of blockchain tech can make it difficult to predict & debug dapp code. The process could be simplified by visual abstraction.

assessments.note: A visual reference for developers is a good idea, even if it becomes read-only.
This would be useful. The Solidity Visual Developer use as an example "only" 10k installs over the period of 2 years, so don't think it's critical requirement.
The proposal does address the issue  of making it easier for developers to work with the plutus framework. A visual tool would definitely help.

Visual representations of complex structures do help certain developers to a large degree. Its definitely not something everyone will use but is useful when it comes to viewing a project at an abstract level. Since this is the type of thing that will help developers I am positive about this.
visualizing what you have written in the smart contract can be really helpful for developers.

I believe the submitter is under-estimating the complexity of the problem. In comparison to Marlowe for example, by the time this is actually usable I suspect maybe an order of magnitude in hours have been invested.

The proposer sounds experienced, but it's hard to verify this . The Github page seems to be only a copy of the Solidity Visual Developer page. The funds requested are only to: "develop an initial 'proof of concept' MVP"
The plan is still described on a higher level but enough information is provided to give me confidence that it can be implemented successfully.

It appears to be a solid plan for me. Basically the idea is to copy the repo based on Ethereum solidity and switch things around to be compatible with cardano. I think thats the right approach in general. The developer shows they are not going to be re-inventing the wheel and that is a good thing in terms of time spent.
Proposal looks to tackle a bit complex subject but as the proposer have already development experience one can take risk.
The goals are clear, but the project seems too ambitious.

There are no metric of success of KPI's. The budget seems reasonable, but given this is to only develop a "proof of concept" there's an added risk this will not materialize into something useful for the Developer ecosystem of Cardano
The roadmap presented for the development of an MVP is quite  straight forward and appears feasible.

Information is demonstrated based on other platforms and what can be done here. There is details on how the budget will be spent. Would be beneficial to add more milestones. I would recommend starting with getting basics visuals working and then expand from there.
the proposer have provided as much as information from his end but as it is on complex piece of software we can assume that it will be difficult to provide 100% information but it feels feasible.

solution: A VSCode plugin for Plutus/Haskell to visualize on-chain transactions, smart contracts, state machine, etc. using nodegraph 'flow' diagrams.
experience: I have experience in UI/UX & graphic design, prototyping, animation/film/video, front-end dev, functional programming & design patterns.
